bibl.author: Thayer & Eldridge
bibl.title: Thayer & Eldridge to Walt Whitman, 11 October 1860
bibl.orgName: Charles E. Feinberg Collection of the Papers of Walt Whitman, 1839–1919, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

body.p: We received your letters with the advertisement which will be attended to. We cannot however stereotype your little book now as we have so much already underway. We shall hardly be ready for it under two months, but shall certainly commence on it by the finish of January.
In regard to money matters, we are very short ourselves and it is quite impossible to send you the sum you name. We would if we could.
Business will be stagnant with us till after the Presidential elections when with our new books we shall get up a rush,

postscript.p: P.S. We will let you know when we are ready for the Banner at Daybreak, so as to give you ample time to make preparations to come on
